shichuanwuhan@... wrote:
> For example:http://www.stanford.edu/~cheriton
> will be changed to http://www.stanford.edu/~cheriton/, and heritrix will return a '301'. How to get a '200'?

To get a 200, and the content, you need to issue a followup request for 
the destination URI that the server gave back along with the 301.

Heritrix will follow these 'R'edirects automatically unless you've 
clipped the redirect-following TransclusionDecideRule (by removing it or 
reducing its allowable hops).

- Gordon @ IA
